	Subject: RE: [junit] Order of execution
	
	
	There i=
s no guarantee that they will run in the order of the
test file and
	you sh=
ould not write your tests in a way that depends on this.
You should
	use th=
e setUp and tearDown methods to properly setup each test. 
	 

I  know that=
 this is the "pure doctrine". But what do you do, if you
have a series of d=
ependent test (some interaction between two systems)
that need a defined pr=
otocoll and therefor a defined order?
 
You may say, these kind of tests ar=
 no unit-tests, but in my experience,
you most of the time need many kind o=
f tests within one application and
i like to make it comfortable and to hav=
e one TestSuite to control as
may tests as possible from one place.
 
Wolfg=
ang
